bibl.title: Letter from Robert Carter to John Pemberton, July 27, 1720

div1.p: Robert Carter writes to Liverpool merchant John Pemberton, July 27, 1720, to advise that he has drawn on Pemberton for £100 because of his purchase of a number of slaves.

div1.head: Letter from Robert Carter to John Pemberton, July 27, 1720

p.hi:
I have lately bin Concernd in the Purchas
of a considerable parcel of Negros One hun
dred Pounds of this money I have adventured
to draw on You for requesting You will answr.

div1.head: NOTES
div1.note: Source copy consulted: Robert Carter Letter Book, 1720 July-1721 July, BR 227, Huntington Library, Art Collections, and Botanical Gardens, San Marino, California. Printed: Wright. Letters of Robert Carter. . . . p 40.

Robert Carter generally used a return address of "Rappahannock" for the river on which he lived rather than "Corotoman," the name of his home, on his correspondence, especially to merchants abroad. The county and colony have been added for clarity. This draft is entirely in the hand of Robert Carter as the use of italics indicates.
